intro: Onosma micranthos, commonly known as the narrow-flowered sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink to purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Onosma micranthos thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry grasslands.
